author: Omar Rashid
text:
To revive itself in Uttar Pradesh ahead of the 2017 elections, the Congress is aggressively eyeing Dalits.

On Thursday, the party released a 22-point manifesto promising better representation for Dalits in the party and a slew of measures and laws that it would bring for their benefit if it came to power. Dalits form 21 per cent of the State electorate.

Congress vice-president Rahul Gandhi launched a direct attack on Bahujan Samaj Party supremo Mayawati, accusing her of crushing Dalit leadership in U.P. Trying to isolate Ms. Mayawati, the Congress vice-president praised her mentor and BSP founder Kanshiram but insisted she had “wasted” the platform built by him for Dalits. Addressing party leaders, workers and Dalit office-bearers at a ‘Dalit Conclave’ here, Mr. Gandhi argued that had Ms. Mayawati “not been fearful of the Dalit youth and leadership, and used their strength,” the community would have achieved far more than it has.

‘Big opportunity’

The BSP’s neglect of Dalit leadership is “a big opportunity” for the Congress to grab Dalit votes, Mr. Gandhi said, even as he expressed confidence that the party would form the government in 2017.

Mr. Gandhi promised that the Congress would create a “yuva dalit leadership”.

Wooing Dalits, the Congress recently concluded its second phase of Bhim Jyoti Yatras aimed at correcting its image among Dalits and “clearing misgivings” about Ambedkar’s relation with the party.
title: Congress eyes Dalit vote bank in Uttar Pradesh
